item.title: Path of Exile 2 Early Access Unlock And Pre-Load Times
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/path-of-exile-2-early-access-unlock-and-pre-load-times/1100-6528225/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Grinding Gear Games has announced that it will be making a standalone PC client available for Path of Exile 2 today, December 4, at 5 PM PT / 8 PM ET for those who want to pre-load the game ahead of time.

Grinding Gear Games will provide the client download through both its own website as well as a torrent simultaneously. While players can download the game's client, they will be unable to log in until the early access period begins on December 6 at 11 AM PT / 2 PM ET.

For Xbox players, pre-download is already available. For PS5 players, purchasing a Founder's Pack should allow for pre-download. Packs should go live 24 hours before early access starts.

With Path of Exile 2 launching into Early Access soon, we've had a lot of players asking for pre-download to ensure they can play on launch. To accommodate this, we’ll be making the standalone PC client available for download at 5pm on Dec 5th (PST).https://t.co/vT6L4kd7qw pic.twitter.com/szPjUH8cV7

— Path of Exile (@pathofexile) December 3, 2024

Path of Exile 2 Early Access Unlock Times

December 6 (North and South America, Europe)

  • 11 AM PT
  • 12 PM MST
  • 1 PM CST
  • 2 PM ET
  • 7 PM GMT
  • 8 PM CET

December 7 (Asia)

  • 4 AM JST
  • 5 AM AEDT

Path of Exile 2 was delayed multiple times, including a last-minute one back at the end of October this year due to server-side issues. However, it looks like it's finally releasing this month. The game will feature full cross-play support, which means players will be able to match up with any other player, regardless of platform. Cross-progression will also be supported, allowing players to keep and carry over their saved data between multiple platforms.

Path of Exile 2 is a top-down action-RPG similar to that of Diablo. The game will enter early access at a price of $30 on December 6 for PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X|S.

George Yang on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Nintendo Adds Another Donkey Kong Game To Switch Online, And It's Still Not DK 64
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/nintendo-adds-another-donkey-kong-game-to-switch-online-and-its-still-not-dk-64/1100-6528220/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Just like that, Nintendo has brought the entire Donkey Kong Land trilogy to Switch Online. Today, Donkey Kong Land 3 has (ahem) landed on the subscription service, though people are still pounding the table for Donkey Kong 64. Sorry: The DK Rap will have to wait.

Donkey Kong Land 3 originally released in 1997 for Game Boy. The side-scrolling title sees Dixie and Kiddy Kong in the spotlight as they search for the Lost World. However, like Donkey Kong and Diddy before them, they'll have to deal with the Kremlings throughout 36 levels.

Not even two weeks ago, Nintendo brought Donkey Kong Land to Switch Online. Then, last week, Donkey Kong Land 2 hit the subscription service. Looking ahead, Donkey Kong Country Returns HD is set to launch next month on Switch, serving as a remaster of the Wii title.

Nintendo has been bringing new games to the Switch Online catalog at a pretty rapid clip recently. Tetris for NES is coming to the subscription service on December 12, and three Sega Genesis titles arrived on Switch Online + Expansion Pack last week.

Switch Online costs $20 a year for individuals, while the premium Expansion Pack option goes for $50 annually. The basic tier offers access to the Game Boy library--including the Donkey Kong Land trilogy--while the Expansion Pack tier offers up Genesis titles as well as Nintendo 64 games (plus more).

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
